tool_description: Schedules and coordinates promotional campaigns with automated start/stop times, channel deployment, and conflict resolution across multiple campaigns.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier for the campaign to schedule

start_datetime.description: Campaign start date and time in ISO 8601 format

end_datetime.description: Campaign end date and time in ISO 8601 format

deployment_channels.description: Channels where campaign will be deployed: website, mobile_app, email, social_media, in_store

priority_level.description: Campaign priority level (1-10, higher is more important)

auto_extend_if_successful.description: Whether to automatically extend campaign if performance exceeds targets

notification_email.description: Email address for campaign status notifications

error_messages: Invalid campaign ID: Campaign identifier not found in system.
Invalid datetime format: Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).
Invalid time range: end_datetime must be after start_datetime.
Invalid deployment channels: Use valid channels from [website, mobile_app, email, social_media, in_store].
Schedule conflict: Another high-priority campaign overlaps with this time period.
Invalid priority level: priority_level must be between 1 and 10.
Invalid email format: notification_email must be a valid email address.
usage: Provide campaign_id, start_datetime, end_datetime, and deployment_channels. Optionally set priority_level, auto_extend option, and notification_email. Returns scheduling confirmation and timeline.

schedule_id.description: Unique identifier for the scheduled campaign

estimated_reach.description: Estimated customer reach across all channels

schedule_status.description: Status of schedule: confirmed, pending, conflict
